Entities.Name: Drug
Entities.Definition: Refers to chemical substances used for treatment, including name, description, formula, and approval status.

Entities.Name: Gene
Entities.Definition: Includes gene names and mutations relevant to drug response.

Entities.Name: Disease
Entities.Definition: Refers to medical conditions, especially cancer types, often linked with gene mutations.

Entities.Name: Body_Part
Entities.Definition: Specific anatomical regions mentioned in relation to disease or drug usage.

Entities.Name: Daily_Dose
Entities.Definition: Refers to the daily dosage of a drug as recommended.

Entities.Name: Dose_Form
Entities.Definition: Describes the form in which a drug is administered (e.g., tablet, injection).

Entities.Name: Frequency
Entities.Definition: How often the drug should be taken within a specific timeframe.

Entities.Name: Adverse_Reaction
Entities.Definition: Undesired effects resulting from drug administration.

Dataset.Name: FDA PGx Biomarker Drug Labels
Dataset.Description: A corpus of 190 manually annotated drug labels related to pharmacogenomics (PGx), drawn from FDA’s table of PGx biomarkers. Used to train BERT–CRF for named entity recognition.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Annotations were based on FDA PGx label sections: ‘Indications and Usage’, ‘Dosage and Administration’, ‘Use in Specific Populations’, and ‘Adverse Reactions’. Each entity was tagged using color highlights. Drug = yellow, Gene = red, Disease = gray, Dose = green, Reaction = purple, Population = blue.
